result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earnest Phillips

9:33 AM Defendant Earnest Phillips in court.  Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson in court for Earnest Phillips.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Tracking with case set for JT.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

9:51 AM Defendant Earnest Phillips in court.  Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson in court for Earnest Phillips.  Attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Matter set to address violation report filed in 22CF925. 
Court indicates the positive result was sent out for testing and came back confirmed. 
Defense indicates the defendant has tested multiple times since that positive test and requests no actions be taken on bond at this time. 
State gives statement and asks for an increase in bond based on violation on bond. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: Bond will increase $2500 cash in 22CF925. 
State addresses the fact that he may be in Kenosha during the JT in 19CF1653. 
Defense indicates the defendant is going in to custody today so that changes their position a bit about a trial going in October, requests to leave it on. 
BTC: Court will leave jury trial today. 

***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY IN 22CF925***
